alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 3:27AM CDT until March 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447, Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Bryant Creek at Highway U and Fox Creek at County Road 246. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Grove, Ava, Mansfield, Norwood, Brushyknob, Dogwood, Goodhope, Drury and Vanzant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
